00058 void Preprocessor::optimalThreshold (const double &threshold)
00059 {
00060     if ( threshold < 0.0 )
00061         optimalThreshold_ = 0.0;
00062     else
00063     {
00064         if ( threshold > 1.0 )
00065             optimalThreshold_ = 1.0;
00066         else
00067             optimalThreshold_ = threshold;
00068     }
00069 };

00090 void Preprocessor::backgroundReferenceGrayLevel (const double &grayLevel)
00091 {

00093         backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = 0.0;
00094     else
00095     {
00096         if ( grayLevel > 1.0 )
00097             backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = 1.0;
00098         else
00099             backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = grayLevel;
00100     }
00101 };

00169 double Preprocessor::findBackgroundReferenceGrayLevel (const Clip &clip, const unsigned int &referenceGrayLevelNeighbours)
00170 {
00171     // Compute image histogram
00172     std::vector<unsigned int> histogram(256, 0);
00173     
00174     for (unsigned int i=0; i < clip.height(); ++i)
00175     {
00176         for (unsigned int j=0; j < clip.width(); ++j)
00177         {
00178             // Get gray level of this pixel
00179             double grayLevel = clip.getPixel(i,j).grayLevel();
00180             
00181             // Update histogram
00182             histogram[std::floor(grayLevel * 255.0)] += 1;
00183         }
00184     }
00185     
00186     
00187     // Search the more frequent level of gray
00188     std::vector<unsigned int>::iterator histogramIterator;
00189     unsigned int moreFrequentGrayLevel = 0, levelCounter = 0;
00190     
00191     for (histogramIterator = histogram.begin(); histogramIterator not_eq histogram.end(); ++histogramIterator, ++levelCounter)
00192     {
00193         if ( *histogramIterator > histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel] )
00194             moreFrequentGrayLevel = levelCounter;
00195     }
00196     backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = moreFrequentGrayLevel * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel];
00197     
00198     
00199     // Search the neighbours of the more frequent level of gray
00200     std::vector<unsigned int>::reverse_iterator histogramReverseIterator( find (histogram.rbegin(), histogram.rend(), histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel])++ );
00201     histogramIterator = histogramReverseIterator.base()++;
00202     double nFrequencies = histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel];
00203     
00204     for ( unsigned int i = 1; i <= referenceGrayLevelNeighbours; ++i )
00205     {
00206         // Search forwards
00207         if ( histogramIterator not_eq histogram.end() )
00208         {
00209             backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ += (moreFrequentGrayLevel + i) * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel + i];
00210             ++histogramIterator;
00211             nFrequencies += histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel + i];
00212         }
00213         
00214         // Search backwards
00215         if ( histogramReverseIterator not_eq histogram.rend() )
00216         {
00217             backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ += (moreFrequentGrayLevel - i) * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel - i];
00218             ++histogramReverseIterator;
00219             nFrequencies += histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel - i];
00220         }
00221     }
00222     
00223     
00224     // Set the background reference gray level found
00225     backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ / nFrequencies) / 255.0;
00226     return backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_;
00227 };

00245 void Preprocessor::removeIsolatedNoise (Clip &clip, const unsigned int &isolationCoefficient)
00246 {
00247     // Find background reference gray level
00248     findBackgroundReferenceGrayLevel(clip);
00249     
00250     
00251     // Loop over the clip to remove every noisy isolated pixel
00252     for (unsigned int i=0; i < clip.height(); ++i)
00253     {
00254         for (unsigned int j=0; j < clip.width(); ++j)
00255         {
00256             unsigned int nBackgroundPixels = 0, nPixels = 0;
00257 
00258             // Explore the pixel neighbourhood
00259             for(int p = i-1; p < (signed int)i+2; p++)
00260             {
00261                 for(int q = j-1; q < (signed int)j+2; q++)
00262                 {
00263                     // Check clip borders
00264                     if ( (p < 0) or (p >= (signed int)clip.height()) )
00265                         continue;
00266                     
00267                     if ( (q < 0) or (q >= (signed int)clip.width()) )
00268                         continue;
00269                     
00270                     nPixels++;
00271                     
00272                     // Get neighbour pixel gray level
00273                     Pixel neighbourPixel = clip.getPixel(p, q);
00274                     
00275                     // When background gray level is close to white but not the pixel, update the noisy neighbours counter
00276                     if ( (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ > optimalThreshold_) and (neighbourPixel.grayLevel() > optimalThreshold_) )
00277                         nBackgroundPixels++;
00278                     else
00279                     {
00280                         // When background gray level is close to black but not the pixel, update the noisy neighbours counter
00281                         if ( (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ < optimalThreshold_) and (neighbourPixel.grayLevel() < optimalThreshold_) )
00282                             nBackgroundPixels++;
00283                     }
00284                 }
00285             }
00286             
00287             // Adjust the isolated coefficient influence according to the number of neighbours found
00288             unsigned int realIsolationCoefficient = nPixels - 8 + (8 - isolationCoefficient);
00289 
00290             // Delete the noisy pixel if it is isolated
00291             if (nBackgroundPixels >= realIsolationCoefficient)
00292                 clip.setPixel(i, j, backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_);
00293         }
00294     }
00295 };
